comments: For n>3 and m>1, a(n) = A000330(m)/(2m+1), for m such that 2m+1 = prime, which results in 2m+1 = prime(n). For example, for m = 8, 2m+1 = 17 = prime(7), A000330(8) = 204, 204/17 = 12 = a(7). - _Richard R. Forberg_, Aug 20 2013For primes => 5, a(n) mod 5 = {0,2}. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Aug 28 2013The only primes in a(n) are 2, 5 and 7 (checked to n = 10,000,000). The set of prime factors of a(n), however, appears to include all primes. - _Richard R. Forberg_, Feb 28 2015
links: Charles R Greathouse IV, Table of n, a(n) for n = 3..10000
maple: A024702:=n->(ithprime(n)^2-1)/24: seq(A024702(n), n=3..70); # _Wesley Ivan Hurt_, Mar 01 2015
prog: (PARI) a(n)=prime(n)^2\24 \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 30 2013(PARI) is(n)=my(k);issquare(24*n+1,&k)&&isprime(k) \\ _Charles R Greathouse IV_, May 31 2013
